str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
From peirazo; a putting to proof (of good), experience (of evil), solicitation, discipline or provocation); by implication, adversity.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To set at naught, ignore, despise. A variation of exoudenoo and meaning the same.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To spit out, disdain, reject, loathe. From ek and ptuo; to spit out, i.e. spurn.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
